rules.name: Headache - red flags
rules.advice: This may require urgent evaluation. If you have any red flag symptoms, go to the nearest emergency department or call emergency services.

rules.name: Headache - moderate risk (age > 50 new onset)
rules.advice: Given your age and new headache, we recommend a prompt appointment to evaluate further.

rules.name: Headache - typical
rules.advice: Try rest, hydration, limited screen time, and acetaminophen as directed. Avoid ibuprofen if your doctor advised against it. If symptoms worsen or persist beyond 48 hours, schedule a visit.

rules.name: Chest pain - emergency
rules.advice: Chest pain can be serious. Please call emergency services now or go to the nearest ER.

rules.name: Fever
rules.advice: Hydration, rest, and acetaminophen can help. If fever is 102Â°F or higher, lasts more than 3 days, or you have trouble breathing, seek care.
